title: 110_s3702
content: The "Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2008" requires compliance with competition requirements for contracts related to natural disaster reconstruction efforts. Written approval is needed for the use of non-competitive procedures for certain contracts. The "Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2008" mandates approval from the President or designee for non-competitive contracts related to natural disaster reconstruction. Congressional notification is required 7 days before awarding such contracts. The "Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2008" requires approval for non-competitive contracts for natural disaster reconstruction. Contracts over $5,000,000 must include a description of scope, contract amount, contractor solicitation process, list of contractors solicited, and justification documents. The "Natural Disaster Fairness in Contracting Act of 2008" mandates approval for non-competitive contracts for disaster reconstruction efforts. Small business contracts authorized by the Small Business Act are exempt from this requirement. SEC. 4. DISCLOSURE REQUIRED. The head of an executive agency must disclose contract details for natural disaster reconstruction efforts, including contract amount, scope, and contractor selection process, publicly before entering into the contract. The disclosure requirements for contracts related to natural disaster reconstruction efforts include providing a list of potential contractors solicited for offers and justification documents for using non-competitive procedures. The section applies to contracts over $5,000,000 and also covers extensions or modifications made using non-competitive procedures before the enactment of the Act. The section on using non-competitive procedures does not apply to contracts authorized by the Small Business Act. It does not affect obligations to disclose government information under other laws. SEC. 5 outlines the requirement for contracts entered into under urgency, stating that contracts for natural disaster reconstruction must be performed within a 6-month period. Extended notification and disclosure deadlines are also specified. SEC. 6 provides definitions. SEC. 6 defines key terms such as "executive agency," "full and open competition," and "natural disaster reconstruction efforts."
